Articles.Content: What do I need to disable to get only the basic thrust balance? Without any Autopilots?

7 hours ago, ChrisXDization said:

What do I need to disable to get only the basic thrust balance? Without any Autopilots? 

By default only the VTOL Assist and Flight Stabilizer autopilots are active; you can disable them in "advanced" pane. After that the only thing left is engine/RCS balancing. And if you have used the vertical speed slider, you need to set it to the maximum to turn off.

15 hours ago, DeepSlayLP said:

http://imgur.com/m4tkA6f

That is the craft. It has two vtol engines at the back of the main fuselage and two on the wings one one each also more to the center of the main fuselage. At the back are three stock engines used to balance the craft.

Nothing seems wrong to me with the craft, and the behaviour you've described does not make sense 

Does TCA lower engine thrust limits at 105m, or something else happens? To what extent does the craft descents from 105m? Does it stop and hover or lands/crashes?

I'm sorry, but you have to describe the situation much more verbosely, or make a video of it. Otherwise I just have no clue as to what happens.

Well, Its a Shuttle, either it starts vertically, and doesnt steer at all (actually MechJeb 2 is steering, Ascent Autopilot.) or it begins to Hover and eventually crashes because it flips upside down..

Tried to make pentacopter from USI parts (Honeybadger + radial turbines), seems like this plugin bad at stabilizing with engines that don't change their thrust instantly (moving them higher makes job easier, but still it stabilizes slowly). How can I make it to not try to stabilize with engines and use just reaction wheel(s)?

31 minutes ago, TAImatem said:

Tried to make pentacopter from USI parts (Honeybadger + radial turbines), seems like this plugin bad at stabilizing with engines that don't change their thrust instantly (moving them higher makes job easier, but still it stabilizes slowly). How can I make it to not try to stabilize with engines and use just reaction wheel(s)?

I figure you're trying to fly it manually; then set your lifting engines to Balanced Thrust mode. And while they're in Main mode you may wish to try the waypoints navigation to see how TCA really copes with such engines.

 

@Logan.Darklighter, is that what you were asking? 

Also: do you see the descriptions of the control widgets in the video? Because I don't 

Edited April 23, 2016 by allista

Hi guys! I downloaded TCA using CKAN plugin, with all its recommendations; i watched the videos, read the manual. I, however, still can't use TCA. Whenever i click on the TCA sign, just the manual appears on the screen. I'm using the latest KSP, 1.1. in case you may ask.

Need suggestion. Thanks in advance!

10 hours ago, Burak said:

Hi guys! I downloaded TCA using CKAN plugin, with all its recommendations; i watched the videos, read the manual. I, however, still can't use TCA. Whenever i click on the TCA sign, just the manual appears on the screen. I'm using the latest KSP, 1.1. in case you may ask.

Need suggestion. Thanks in advance!

1) is ModuleManager installed and working?

2) if it does not work in Career but does in Sandbox, you haven't purchased the TCA Subsystem in R&D.

3) otherwise, publish the output_log.txt (Player.log on Linux) that is generated after you launch the game and observe the problem.

18 minutes ago, allista said:

1) is ModuleManager installed and working?

2) if it does not work in Career but does in Sandbox, you haven't purchased the TCA Subsystem in R&D.

3) otherwise, publish the output_log.txt (Player.log on Linux) that is generated after you launch the game and observe the problem.

I replaced my old module manager with the up-to-date one, everything work better now. Thanks! I guess i'm going to blame CKAN for this inconvenience .

I really have no idea what I'm doing wrong but every time I try to VTO TCA just limits the throttle to zero and the craft sits there doing nothing. I've unlocked VTOL module long ago in R&D and I've tried just enabling, level mode, hover mode, kill rotation, none of it's working for me :(. I've got my lifting engine set to balanced thrust and I can VTO the craft manually but VL is another story so I was really looking forward to using this mod. Any help would be really appreciated, looks like an awesome mod, I hope I'm just doing something wrong.

Edit - Tried it with an older 4 engine "hovercraft" I made and it worked, I guess it just doesn't like single engine vtol.

Yup, can confirm, had the same frustration. It's just how the mod works, it balances thrust so you need multiple engines, even just a small secondary can work.

1 hour ago, CatastrophicFailure said:

Yup, can confirm, had the same frustration. It's just how the mod works, it balances thrust so you need multiple engines, even just a small secondary can work. 

In fact, as it is apparently a popular problem, I will try to figure something out to handle this scenario. Maybe another engine mode that explicitly prevents balancing but allows v-speed/altitude control?

I haven't tried out the new version yet, but is there a way to disable the tech tree requirements if I wanted to?

19 minutes ago, smjjames said:

I haven't tried out the new version yet, but is there a way to disable the tech tree requirements if I wanted to?

Yep! At the top of TCA.glob set the IntegrateIntoCareer option to false.

9 minutes ago, allista said:

Yep! At the top of TCA.glob set the IntegrateIntoCareer option to false.
